p: Our study provides a good baseline for decision makers and stakeholders on where and how resources should be invested in the most efficient way to protect Georgia's high plant richness from IAPs (Maxwell et al., 2009). Various management tools are available ranging from programs to prevent the introduction of IAPs (e.g., Leung et al., 2002), eradication (Panetta et al., 2011), or mitigation through physical (cutting), chemical, or biocontrol programs (Müller‐Schärer & Collins, 2012; Müller‐Schärer & Schaffner, 2008).
